etymology.description: 尌(尌) (shù, "to plant a tree") -> 木(木) (mù, "tree") added for visual differentiation -> final form 樹
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 樹 (shù, "tree") combines the semantic component 木(木) (mù, "tree") with the phonetic 尌(尌) (shù, "to plant a tree"), which emphasizes the idea of planting or establishing a tree. The addition of 木 helps to visually distinguish the character from 尌 and reinforces the meaning related to trees.
etymology.simplification: 树(樹): The component 壴(壴) (zhù, "drum") was replaced with 又(又) (yòu, "again") for a simpler form.

examples.chinese: 公园里的樹(公園裡的樹)很茂盛(很茂盛)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngyuán lǐ de shù hěn màoshèng.
examples.english: The trees in the park are luxuriant.

examples.chinese: 这棵樹在春天抽出嫩芽(這棵樹在春天抽出嫩芽)，夏日遮阴带来凉爽(夏日遮陰帶來涼爽)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kē shù zài chūntiān chōu chū nèn yá, xiàrì zhēyīn dàilái liángshuǎng.
examples.english: This tree sprouts tender buds in spring, and its shade brings coolness in summer.

examples.chinese: 古老的樹静静伫立(古老的樹靜靜佇立)，见证着历史长河(見證著歷史長河)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔlǎo de shù jìngjìng zhùlì, jiànzhèng zhe lìshǐ chánghé.
examples.english: The ancient tree stands quietly, witnessing the long river of history.
